required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PROM Collected Via a WebApp Versus a Touch Screen Solution Among Patients With SLE
clinical_study.official_title: Patient-reported Outcome Measures Collected in DANBIO Via a From Home Web Application Versus a Touchscreen in the Outpatient Clinic Among Patients With Systemic Lupus Erythematosus: A Randomised, Crossover, Agreement Study

brief_summary.textblock: A randomised, within-participants cross-over design trial including 34 patients with systemic lupus erythematosus. The participants will be randomised to data registration of patient reported outcome measures (PROM) through the DANBIO webapp and thereafter via the outpatient touchscreen or vice versa.

detailed_description.textblock:
The aim of this trial is to evaluate whether electronic reporting of PROMs through the DANBIO web application (webapp) is comparable to the outpatient touchscreen among patients with SLE.
The trial is a randomised, crossover, agreement study where 34 patients with SLE from the Department of Rheumatology at Aalborg University Hospital will be included and randomised in ratio 1:1 to:
- Group 1: PROMs are reported through the DANBIO webapp; thereafter, the touchscreen.
- Group 2: PROMs are reported through the touchscreen; thereafter, the DANBIO webapp.
There will be a wash-out period of 1-2 day between the two registrations to minimise carryover bias.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A randomised, within-participants, open, cross-over trial

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Systemic Lupus Activity Questionnaire global health
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (first data registration) and day 3 (second data registration)
primary_outcome.description: Evaluates global assessment of lupus activity using an NRS score from 0-10. Higher score Means worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (first data registration) and day 3 (second data registration)
secondary_outcome.description: Assess the patient's physical function from 0-3. Higher score Means worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (first data registration) and day 3 (second data registration)
secondary_outcome.description: The patient's assessment of pain on a scale from 0-100 within the last week.The left of the scale (0) signifies the absence of pain and the right end (100) maximum pain.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (first data registration) and day 3 (second data registration)
secondary_outcome.description: The patient's assessment of fatigue on a scale from 0-100 within the last week. The left of the scale (0) signifies the absence of fatigue and the right end (100) maximum fatigue.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (first data registration) and day 3 (second data registration)
secondary_outcome.description: The patient's global assessment of disease activity (arthritis severity) on a scale from 0-100 within the last week. The left of the scale (0) signifies the absence of arthritis activity and the right end (100) maximum arthritis activity.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (first data registration) and day 3 (second data registration)
secondary_outcome.description: The patient's assessment of acceptable symptom state. Consist of one question answered with "yes" or "no". The question is: ''Take into account all the ways in which your arthritis has affected you in the past 48 hours. If you were to remain for the next few months as you are today, would it be acceptable to you?"

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (first data registration) and day 3 (second data registration)
secondary_outcome.description: The patient's assessment of change in arthritis activity since last visit from much worse to much better.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (first data registration) and day 3 (second data registration)
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluates presence or severity of lupus flare on a transitional scale e.g. 0 (no worsening), 1 (mild worsening), 2 (moderate worsening) or 3 (severe worsening).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (first data registration) and day 3 (second data registration)
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluates the number of lupus specific symptoms present from 0-24. Higher score means worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (first data registration) and day 3 (second data registration)
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluates severity of lupus disease activity by a weighted score of the 24 lupus specific symptoms, range 0-44. Higher score means worse outcome.

arm_group.description: PROM registration via the DANBIO WebApp and thereafter the outpatient touchscreen
PROM registration via the outpatient touchscreen and thereafter the DANBIO WebApp

intervention.intervention_name: PROM registration via the DANBIO WebApp and the outpatient touchscreen in a randomised order
intervention.description: PROM registration via the DANBIO WebApp and the outpatient touchscreen in a randomised order

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed in DANBIO with SLE
- Experience with the PROM questionnaires in DANBIO (≥ 1 previous assessments)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to provide informed consent or to comply with the study protocol
- Diagnosis of SLE of ≥ 12 months
- Does not have access to a device that can run the DANBIO webapp

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Rheumatology, Aalborg University Hospital
